statements: Policing should aim to reduce harm and prevent crime while respecting constitutional rights and treating every person with dignity, recognizing that communities want both safety and fairness. A balanced approach combines targeted, evidence-based enforcement focused on serious violence with strong safeguards—clear use-of-force standards, de-escalation, transparent data, and independent accountability—to deter misconduct and build trust. Investing in community partnerships and co-responder or non-police responses for mental health and low-level issues can improve outcomes, allowing officers to focus on threats while reducing unnecessary confrontations.
